| Retirement KITAS 5yr (E33E) | 18,000,000 | ~$1,100 | 4-5 weeks |
| KITAP (Permanent Residence) | 25,000,000 | ~$1,550 | 6-8 weeks |
| Golden Visa | 50,000,000 | ~$3,100 | 8-12 weeks |
| Second Home Visa | 25,000,000 | ~$1,550 | 4-6 weeks |
| GCI (Global Citizenship) | 50,000,000 | ~$3,100 | 8-12 weeks |

*Government fees not included. Prices subject to change.*

### 2. Company Setup (PT PMA)

| Service | Price (IDR) | Price (USD) | Timeline |
|---------|-------------|-------------|----------|
| PT PMA Full Registration | 45,000,000 | ~$2,800 | 4-8 weeks |
| NIB & Business Licenses | Included | Included | - |
| Bank Account Setup | Included | Included | - |
| Virtual Office (1 year) | 15,000,000 | ~$930 | - |

**PT PMA Requirements:**
- Minimum investment: IDR 10 billion (~$620,000)
- Paid-up capital per shareholder: IDR 2.5 billion (~$155,000)
- Indonesian director required (can be nominee)

## Visa Types Explained

### KITAS (Temporary Stay Permit)
- **C312 (Director)**: For PT PMA directors/commissioners
- **C313 (Investor)**: For PT PMA shareholders with IDR 1B+ investment
- **C314 (Employee)**: For workers with RPTKA approval
- **E33F (Retirement 1yr)**: Age 55+, proof of $1,500/month pension
- **E33E (Retirement 5yr)**: Same as E33F, longer validity

### Golden Visa (Premium 5-10 Year Stay)
- Investment threshold: $350,000+ in Indonesian assets
- Categories: Investor, Second Home Buyer, Director, Specialist
- Benefits: Multiple entry, longer stay, family inclusion

### Second Home Visa
- Proof of funds: $130,000+ (bank statement)
- No investment required, just proof of wealth
- 5-10 year validity with annual reporting

## Key Topics & FAQs

### Can foreigners own property in Indonesia?
No, foreigners cannot own freehold land (Hak Milik). However, foreigners CAN:
- Own buildings on Hak Pakai (Right to Use) land - up to 80 years
- Hold long-term leases (Hak Sewa) - typically 25-30 years
- Own property through a PT PMA company (Hak Guna Bangunan)

### What is the minimum investment for PT PMA?
- Total investment: IDR 10 billion (~$620,000 USD)
- Paid-up capital: IDR 2.5 billion per shareholder (~$155,000 USD)
- Can be invested over time, not all upfront

### How long does PT PMA registration take?
With Bali Zero: 4-8 weeks including NIB, business licenses, and bank account.

### Can I work on a retirement visa?
NO. Retirement visas (E33F and E33E) strictly prohibit any employment or business activity. You need a work permit (KITAS C312/C313/C314) to work legally.

### What is the 183-day tax rule?
If you spend 183+ days in Indonesia within 12 months, you become a tax resident and must:
- Register for NPWP (tax ID)
- File annual tax return (SPT) by March 31
- Pay progressive income tax (5-35%)

### What is Coretax?
Indonesia's new digital tax platform (launched 2025-2026) that modernizes:
- Tax registration and filing
- Invoice and payment processing
- Compliance monitoring

## Content Categories

Our knowledge base articles are organized at:
- `/immigration/` - Visa guides, KITAS, KITAP, work permits, Golden Visa
- `/business/` - PT PMA setup, company registration, KBLI codes, OSS
- `/tax-legal/` - Tax compliance, Coretax, NPWP, SPT filing
- `/property/` - Real estate, Hak Pakai, villa investment, Airbnb rules
- `/lifestyle/` - Living in Bali, expat life, cost of living, culture
- `/digital-nomad/` - Remote work visas, coworking, nomad community

- Property law (UUPA, Hak Pakai regulations)

Available 24/7 at: https://zantara.balizero.com/chat

Zantara can answer:
- Visa eligibility and requirements
- Company setup procedures and costs
- Tax obligations and deadlines

- Real-time pricing quotes

## Official Sources We Reference

- imigrasi.go.id - Immigration department
- oss.go.id - Online Single Submission (business licensing)
- pajak.go.id - Tax department
- investindonesia.go.id - Investment coordination board (BKPM)
